abstract.text: An object that collects the changes you want to save to the user’s contacts database.

inlineContent.text: object for each save operation you want to make. You can batch multiple changes into one save request (note that these changes only apply to objects). In the case of overlapping changes in multiple or concurrent save requests, the last change wins.
If you try to add an object (that is, a contact or a group) that already exists in the contact store, you receive the

array is updated to contain the object you tried to add. If you try to update or delete an object that is not present in the contact store, the save request does not perform the update or deletion, the
array is updated to contain the object you tried to update or delete. Do not access objects in the save request while that request is executing.

abstract.text: Access the user’s contacts, and format and localize contact information.
An object that defines the options to use when fetching contacts.
An error that indicates the inserted record already exists.
An error that indicates a record doesn’t exist.
The contact, group, and container objects for which the error code applies.
The base class for contact fetch requests.
An object that represents the result of a change-history fetch request.
An object that collects the changes you want to save to the user’s contacts database.
Adds a group to the contact store.
Adds the specified contact to the contact store.
Adds a contact as a member of a group.
Add the specified group to a parent group.
Deletes a group from the contact store.
Deletes a contact from the contact store.
Removes a contact as a member of a group.
Remove a subgroup from the specified parent group.
A Boolean value that indicates whether to refetch the added and updated contacts after the save request executes.
A string that identifies the author of the transaction.
Updates an existing contact in the contact store.
Updates an existing group in the contact store.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
